```{r}
set.seed(25420)
```


```{r}
#Set our n to 25 for X1...X25, alpha to .1 and, mu0 to 2
n <- 20
alpha <- .1
df <- 1
#Mean of a chisq distribution is equal to the degrees of freedom
mu0 <- df

#Set m to 10000 replicates
m <- 10000

p <- numeric(m) #To store p value

#Run our simulation
for(j in 1:m){
  x <- rchisq(n,df)
  ttest <- t.test(x, alternative = "t", mu = mu0)
  p[j] <- ttest$p.value
}

#Print our p.hat 
(p.hat <- mean(p < alpha))
```

```{r}
#Set our n to 20
n <- 20
alpha <- .1

#Set m to 10000 replicates
m <- 10000

min <- 0
max <- 2
#Mean of a uniform distribution is equal to the (a + b)/2
mu0 <- (min+max)/2

p <- numeric(m) #To store p value

#Run our simulation
for(j in 1:m){
  x <- runif(n,min,max)
  ttest <- t.test(x, alternative = "t", mu = mu0)
  p[j] <- ttest$p.value
}

#Print our p.hat 
(p.hat <- mean(p < alpha))
```
```{r}
#Set our n to 20
n <- 20
alpha <- .1

#Set m to 10000 replicates
m <- 10000

rate <- 1
#Mean of a exponential distribution is equal to the 1/rate
mu0 <- 1/rate

p <- numeric(m) #To store p value

#Run our simulation
for(j in 1:m){
  x <- rexp(n,rate)
  ttest <- t.test(x, alternative = "t", mu = mu0)
  p[j] <- ttest$p.value
}

#Print our p.hat 
(p.hat <- mean(p < alpha))
```
